Moving to UI since it breaks in AbstractRepositoryTaskEditor. Probably has something to do with repository manager initialization at startup, so we get null from TasksUiPlugin.getRepositoryManager() call

Eugene: I tried to replicate but JIRA editors are restored fine in my test workspace.  Could the task that caused this have a null repository?

Rob: consider putting in a safeguard on the offending line.

(In reply to comment #2)
> Eugene: I tried to replicate but JIRA editors are restored fine in my test
> workspace.  Could the task that caused this have a null repository?

I don't think so. To me it seems like a racing condition where RepositoryManager haven't been initialized yet.
Seems odd since on line 435 of TaskEditor we're checking for null input before initializing editor with  that input.

(In reply to comment #4)
> Seems odd since on line 435 of TaskEditor we're checking for null input before
> initializing editor with  that input.

Rob, stacktrace is outdated. You'll need to look at the revision 1.136 (before May 24). The NPE happens on the line:

connector = TasksUiPlugin.getRepositoryManager().getRepositoryConnector(repository.getKind());

PS: apparently I accidentally committed one of my patches for AbstractTaskEditor with some jira stuff last night. I thought that I don't have permossions for tasks.ui project.

> > initializing editor with  that input.

There are layout changes but due to changes from bug 175205 that Mik also asked you to look at.

Rob: I assume you'll review any sideffects of Eugene's commits (the Attribute weirdness we were seeing).

Eugene: let me know if there's anything progress from my end blocking this.
I haven't seen this error in the latest builds.
